info.title: ICAPT
info.description:
The iCAPT API allows you to integrate and interact the iCAPT system with any API-enabled Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. The API would allow for you to perform the following functions within the Production and Inventory Modules of the iCAPT system:

1.	Create, edit and delete Master Files and Transaction Files throughout the iCAPT system using HTTP verbs
2.	Upload Transaction History into your API-enabled ERP system. For example: Material Transactions and Job Transactions 
3.	Extract transaction and file listings 
4.	Read Master Data by ID

User may perform operation in iCAPT via API such as extract listing, read master data by ID, create master/transactional data, edit master/transaction data and delete data by using the HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE).

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Warehouse List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Warehouse should be made using the Update function.

post.description:
The Warehouse List contains the collection of all the warehouse codes, description and addresses currently utilized by the business. For a warehouse to be available in the system record, the warehouse must be created and present in the Warehouse List.

This method gives a Site admin the option to create warehouse for a given Site.

### Warehouse Input Attributes:
In order to create a warehouse, the following are required field
- **Warehouse**: The designated code given to the warehouse
- **Description**: Description or full name of the warehouse
- **Address**: The full address of the given warehouse

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Warehouse by their given unique ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Warehouse should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one warehouse from the Warehouses list.

## Exception
**Warehouse is unable to delete if:**
  - At least one location (item location/lot location) exist for warehouse.
  - If warehouse exist in at least one material transaction.
  - At least one PO Line /CO Line/Job/Job Material/Transfer Order  exists for warehouse 

This warehouse will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to change aspects of an existing warehouse.

**These entities are read only:**
- id
- whse_num
- site_id

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Locations List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Location should be made using the Update function.

post.description:
The Location List contains the collection of all locations within the warehouse. For a location to be available in the system record, the location must be created and present in the Location List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Location

### Location Input Attributes:
In order to create a location, the following are required field
- **Warehouse**: The warehouse of the location on
- **Location**: The designated code given to the location
- **Trans Type**: The function of the location. Stock - S, Quarantine - Q or Transit - T

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Location by their given unique Location ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Location should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Location from the Locations list

## Exception: 
**Location is unable to delete if:**
   - Location exists in Item Location / Lot Location

This location will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to update location.

**These entities are read only:**
- whse_num
- loc_id

post.description:
The Item List contains the collection of all items currently in use by the company. For an Item to be available in the system record, the item must be created and present in the Item List.

This method gives a Site admin the option to create an Item for a given Site.

### Items Input Attributes:
In order to create a new item, the following are required field
- **Item Number**: The designated code given to the part/item
- **Item Description**: The item description and may contain specifications/name of the item
- **UOM**: The unit of measurement of the item. UOM defined must be exist in iCAPT
- **Product Code**: Material classification. Product code defined must be exist in in iCAPT
- **Unit Weight**: The expected mass per unit of part/item. The default UOM for weight is Kilogram (KG)
- **Lot Tracked**: Item is lot tracked indicator. Lot tracked item must have lot number specified in all transactions
- **Status**: Active status of item

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Item List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Item should be made using the Update function.

post.description:
The Customer List contains the collection of all customers the business is in conduct with. For a customer to be available in the system record, the customer details must be created and present within the Customer List. 

This method gives a Site admin the option to create a Customer for a given Site.

### Customer Input Attributes:
In order to create a customer, the following are required field
- **Customer Code**: A unique code to identifies the customer
- **Name**: Description/Name of customer
- **Active Status**: Status of customer

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Customers List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to the Customer should be made using the Update function.

The Product Code List contains the collection of all products currently or previously in use within the production facility. For a product to be available in the system record, the product code must be created and present in the Product Code List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Product Code.

### Product Code Input Attributes:
In order to create a product code, the following are required field
- **Product Code**: The designated code given to the product classification. This 
- **Active**: IIndicator of availability. 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Item from the Items list.

## Exception : 
**The item is unable to delete if:**
   - Item location exists with Qty On Hand not 0
   - At least one PO Line /CO Line/Job/Job Material/Transfer Order exists for the Item

This Item will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

post.description:
The Reason Code List contains the collection of all reasons required when conducting certain transaction forms. A reason code defines the purpose certain transactions are performed. For a Reason Code to be available in the system record, the Reason Code must be created and present in the Reason Code List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Reason Code.

### Reason Code Input Attributes:
In order to create a reason code, the following are required field
- **Transaction**: Transactions where the reason code is used
- **Code**: Reason Code

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Reason Codes List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Reason Code should be made using the Update function.

The Purchase Order (PO) List contains the collection of all PO used throughout the inventory management and production cycle. For a PO to be available in the system record, the PO must be created and present in the PO List.

This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Purchase Order Lines. 
Note: This generation is read-only.

post.description: The Login function allows users to retrieve their system settings and privileges from the iCAPT database, enabling them to access and perform functions provided by the iCAPT system. To be able to Login, a user must first have a login ID and password assigned to them from an Administrator.

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Reason Code by their given unique Reason Code ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Reason Code should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Reason Code from the Reason Codes list.

## Exception
**Reason code is unable to delete if:**
  - At least one material/machine/job transaction exists for the reason code

Reason code will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to change aspects of an existing reason code.

**These entities are read only:**
- reason_class
- reasoncode_ID

post.description:
The UOM List contains the collection of all units of measurement that can be associated with an item. A base unit of measure should be assigned to each item on the Items form For a UOM to be available in the system record, the UOM must be created and present in the UOM List.

This method gives a Site admin the option to create UOM for a given Site.

### UOM Input Attributes:
In order to create a UOM, the following are required field
- **UOM**: The designated code given to the unit of measurement
- **Description**: Description of the UOM
- **Rounding Decimals**: Determines the number of decimal places the unit of measurement

## Exception
**UOM is unable to delete if:**

This UOM will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

post.description:

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Task.

### Reason Code Input Attributes:
In order to create a task, the following are required field
- **Code**: Indirect task code

## Exception
**Task is unable to delete if:**

Task will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

Vendor will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

post.description:
The Item Location List contains the collection of all locations within the warehouse and the item parts designated to them. The Item Location List also tracks the available quantity on hand for a certain item in each location. For an item location to be available in the system record, the customer must be created and present in the Customer List.

This method gives a Site admin the option to create an Item Location for a given Site.

### Items Location Input Attributes:
In order to create a new item location, the following are required field
- **Warehouse**: Identifies the warehouse the item is stored in
- **Location**: Identified the specific location within abovementioned warehouse the item is stored in
- **Item**: Identifies the item that is stored in the abovementioned warehouse and location
- **Qty on hand**: The total number of units in the warehouse location at the current time
- **Rank**: Location ranking of the item. 1 being the highest and will be the default location for this item

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Item Locations List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Item Location should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Item Location by their given unique ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Item Location should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Item Location from the Item Locations list.

## Exception:
**Item location is unable to delete if:**
  -  Qty On Hand is not 0

This Item Location will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to update the item location.

**The following properties are read only:**
-id
-whse_num
-loc_num
-item_num
-site_id

post.description:
The Lot List contains the collection of all Lot number and location for each Lot tracked Item Part. A lot is a quantity of material you choose to group together. For a Lot to be available in the system record, the Lot Location must be created and present in the Lot List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Lot Location.

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Lot Location List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Lot Location should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Lot Location from the Lot Locations list.

## Exception: 
Lot Location is unable to delete if:
  -  Qty On Hand is not 0

This Lot Location will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

post.description: Use this method to update item lot location.

The Employee List contains the collection of all employees employed by the production floor and have access to the iCAPT system. For an employee to be available in the system record, the employee must be created and present in the Employee List.

This method gives the Site admin the option to create an Employee

### Employees Input Attributes:
In order to create a employee, the following are required field
- **Employee Number**: A unique number to identifies the employee
- **Employee Name**: Description/Name of employee
- **Shift**: Employee Shift

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Employees List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Employee should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Employee by their given unique ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Employee should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Employee from the Employees list.

## Exception:
**Employee is unable to delete if:**
   - Employee exists as a Counter

This Employee will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to change aspects of an existing employee.

**These entities are read only:**
- id
- emp_num
- site_id

post.description:
The Machine List contains the collection of all machines used throughout the production cycle. For a machine to be available in the system location, the machine must be created and present in the Machine List.

This method allows the Site admin to create a Machine.

### Machine Input Attributes:
In order to create a machine, the following are required field
- **Machine ID**: A unique code to identifies the machine
- **Description**: Description of the machine
- **Active**: Identifies the active status of the machine. 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Machines List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Machine should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Machines by their given unique Machine ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Machine should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Machine from the Machines list.

## Exception: 
**Machine is unable to delete if:**
  -  Mahcine exist in at least one material/job transaction


Machine will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to update machine.

**These entities are read only:**
- machine_ID

post.description:
The Customer Order (CO) List contains the collection of all CO used throughout the inventory management and production cycle. For a CO to be available in the system record, the CO must be created and present in the CO List.

This method gives the Site admin the option to create a Customer Orders.

### Customer Order Input Attributes:
In order to create a customer order, the following are required field
- **CO Number**: A CO Number uniquely identifies a customer order
- **CO Line**: Line Item
- **CO Release**: Release or sub-line
- **Warehouse**: Warehouse to ship from.
- **Item**: Item that is ordered by customer 
- **Due Date**: Target shipping date
- **Status**: Status of the CO
- **Customer Code**: Customer of the order
- **Qty Ordered**: Quantity of the item ordered 
- **Qty Released**: Quantity of the item to be order on this specified CO

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Customer Orders List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Customer Order should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Customer Orders by their given unique CO Number. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Customer Order should be made using the Update function.

post.description:
The Transfer Order (TO) List contains the collection of all TO in use throughout the inventory management and production cycle. For a TO to be available in the system record, the TO must be created and present in the TO List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Transfer Order.

### Transfer Order Input Attributes:
In order to create a tranfer order, the following are required field
- **TO number**: A TO Number uniquely identifies a transfer order
- **From Warehouse**: Warehouse transfer order from
- **TO Warehouse**: Warehouse transfer order to
- **Status**: Status of the TO. Open - O, Completed - C

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Transfer Orders List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Transfer Order should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Transfer Order by their given unique ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Transfer Order should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Transfer Order from the Transfer Orders list. 

## Exception
**Transfer order is unable to delete if:**
  - Transfer Order status is Completed
  - Qty Shipped, Qty Transferred or Qty Loss is not 0
  - Material Transaction exists for Transfer Order

Transfer Order will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to change aspects of an existing transfer order.

**These entities are read only:**
- transferorder_ID
- to_warehouese
- from_warehouse

post.description:
The Job Order List contains the collection of all job orders used throughout the production cycle. For a job order to be available in the system record, the job order must be created and present in the Job Order List.

This method gives the Site admin the option to create a Job Order.

### Job Order Input Attributes:
In order to create a new job order, the following are required field
- **Job ID**: Unique ID to identifies the job order
- **Warehouse**: Warehouse to receive in
- **Customer Code**: Customer for this job order
- **Item**: Item that is being produced from the order 
- **Job Date**: Job order creation date
- **Start Date**: Date to begin production
- **Qty Released**: The quantity required to be produce
- **Status**: Status of the Job. Open (O), Released (R) or Completed (C)

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Job Order List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Job Order should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Job Order by their given unique Job Order ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this [category] should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Job Order from the Job Orders list.

## Exception: 
**Job order is unable to delete if:**
  - Job Status is Completed
  - Qty Completed or Qty Scrapped is not 0 
  - At least one Material Transaction exists for this Job Order
  - Job order have existed job route

Job Order will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Update Job Order in iCAPT.

**The following properties are read only:**

- joborder_id
- whse_num
- item_num
- description
- uom
- qty_complete
- qty_scrapped
- site_id

**Not allowed to update if:**
- If job order status = closed

**Not allowed to update qty released if:**
- If job order status <> open

post.description:
The Job Route List contains the collection of all operations and work centers tied to a job order throughout the production cycle. For a Job Route to be available in the system record, the Job Route must be created and present in the Job Route List.

This method gives the Site admin the option to create a Job Route.

### Job Route Input Attributes:
In order to create a new job route, the following are required field
- **Job ID**: Unique ID to identifies the job order
- **Warehouse**: Warehouse to receive in
- **Operation**: Sequence number of the process
- **Work Center**: The station/work center performing this process
- **Status**: Active flag. 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Job Route] List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Job Route should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Job Route by their given unique Job ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Job Route should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Job Route from the Job Routes list. 

## Exception: 
**Job route is unable to delete if:**
  - Job status for this Job Route is Completed
  - Qty Moved, Qty Completed, Qty Received or Qty Scrapped is not 0
  - Material Transaction exists for this Job Route
  - Job route have existed job material

Job Route will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
This method to update Job Route in iCAPT.

**The following properties are read only:**

- joborder_id
- oper_num
- qty_moved
- qty_completed
- qty_received  
- qty_scrapped

**Not allowed to update if:**
- If job order status = closed

post.description:
The Job Material List contains the collection of all materials required per job route of a job order applicable throughout the production cycle. For a material to be available in the system record, the materials must be created and present in the Job Material List.

This method allows the Site admin the option to create a Job Material.

### Job Material Input Attributes:
In order to create a new job material, the following are required field
- **Job ID**: Unique ID to identifies the job order
- **Warehouse**: Warehouse to receive in
- **Operation**: Sequence number of the process
- **Sequence**: Sequence of material. Required to be unique
- **Material**: Item required in production
- **Qty per**: Quantity of material needed for a finished good
- **Scrap Factor**: The expected loss factors

get.description:
This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Job Material List. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Job Material should be made using the Update function.

This method allows the Site admin to filter and search for specific Job Material by their given unique Job ID. 
Note: This generation is read-only and changes to this Job Material should be made using the Update function.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Job Material from the  Job Materials list

## Exception: 
**Job material is unable to delete if:**
  - Job Status is Completed
  - Qty Moved, Completed, Received and Scrapped is not 0 
  - At least one Material Transaction exists for this Job Material

Job Material will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

put.description:
Use this method to change aspects of an existing job material.

**These entities are read only:**
- id
- job_num
-oper_num
-site_id
-qty_issued

**Not allowed to update if:**
- If job order status = closed

get.description:
The Material Transaction History provides the listing of all material movement throughout the manufacturing floor from inflow, during process and outflow. The Material Transaction History provides users with easy access to information regarding any and all materials through the use of filters. 

This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Material Transaction History. 
Note: This generation is read-only.

The Job Transaction History provides the listing of all jobs performed on the manufacturing floor by employees during the production process for any given item. The Job Transaction History provides easy access to information regarding any and all jobs performed through the use of filters.

This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Job Transaction List.

The Machine Transaction History provides the listing of all machine usage for Setup, Run time and Downtime throughout the manufacturing floor. The Machine Transaction History provides easy access to information regarding any and all machines through the use of filters.

This method allows the Site admin to generate the list of all items within the Machine Transaction History.
Note: This generation is read-only.

delete.description:
This method gives a site the option to delete one Customer Order Item from the Customer Order Items list. 

## Exception:
**Customer order is unable to delete if:**
  - Customer Order Item status is Completed
  - Qty Shipped or Qty Returned is not 0
  - Material Transaction exists for Customer Order Item

Customer Order Item will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

The Transfer Order (TO) Line contains the details in regard to an attached Transfer Order. The details of the Line provide information regarding what Item, Location and Quantity that would be involved during the TO. For a TO Line to be available in the system record, the TO Line must first be created from an attached TO in the TO List.

This method gives a site the option to delete one Transfer Order Line from the Transfer Order Lines list. 

## Exception
**Transfer order line is unable to delete if:**
  - Transfer Order Line status is Completed
  - Qty Shipped , Qty Received or Qty Loss is not 0
  - Material Transaction exists for this Transfer Order Line

Transfer Order Line will be immediately removed. This action is not reversible.

uom_num.description: The designated code given to the unit of measurement

rounding.description: Determines the number of decimal places the unit of measurement will be displayed

created_by.description: User that created the UOM

modified_by.description: User that last modified the UOM

created_date.description: The timestamp when the UOM was created

modified_date.description: The timestamp when the UOM was last modified

created_by.description: The user ID that created the customer

modified_by.description: The user ID that last edited the customer information

created_date.description: The timestamp when the customer was created

modified_date.description: The timestamp when the customer was last edited

qty.description: Transacted quantity.  Positive for increase. Negative for decrease

whse_num.description: Warehouse where the transaction was performed

loc_num.description: Location where the transaction was performed

lot_num.description: Identifies the lot tracked number for the item if present

wc.description: Work center related to the production operation and job route
